result.heading: 104 BENNY DROPS THE BABE RUTH AUTOGRAPH

direction.raw_text: Benny HITS the dirt with a gut twisting THUD! Dust everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The gang climbs the fence. They look down into
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: hops down and races over. Suddenly, from the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His shirt snagged:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Help him! I'm stuck! I'm stuck! Help him!

direction.raw_text: is hanging from the fence. His chain has caught. He struggles - choking to death - right below Scotty.

direction.raw_text: petrifies where they stand.

direction.raw_text: tears his shirt loose. Scrambles to where The Beast hangs. Tries to lift the tow chain free - too heavy! He'll die in seconds.

direction.raw_text: Pick him up! Scoot him up so I can let him off! (DESPERATE)

direction.raw_text: Easy. Easy, boy.

direction.raw_text: whimpers. Scotty balances atop the fence. Grabs the tow chain. Lifts with all his might... his fingers bleed. The Beast goes limp. An inch. That did it! The beast falls.

direction.raw_text: goes with him - 8 feet to the dirt. The FENCE COMES DOWN - breaking the barrier to the sandlot. He lands on the ground

direction.raw_text: with The Beast.

direction.raw_text: scans them instinctively - He might kill them all where they stand.

direction.raw_text: about to load up his fruit o' da looms.

direction.raw_text: wipes away the Beast slob. He doesn't even have to kneel down to read the name on The Beast's "doggy tag." It says... ...Hercules. This time Scotty gives Benny "Thumbs Up."

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE'S BACK DOOR Scotty KNOCKS. MR. MERTLE answers the door. An old man with dark glasses. He comes out on the porch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE Hello?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Um, we brought your dog home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE Hercules? How'd he get out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, sir... um, we kind of, well, what happened was -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - we hit a baseball into your yard. Then we tried to get it and -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE - why didn't you just come to the door... I'd have gotten it for you. Squints, Yeah-Yeah, Ham, DeNunez, Repeat, Timmy and Bertram faint.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE (CONT'D) Well, thanks for bringin' him back. (BEAT) Why don't you boys come in... we can talk about baseball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE'S HOUSE - DAY Fairly spartan, except for one room, where it seems that Mr. Mertle spends most of his time. He leads Benny and Scotty
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Mertle sits at a table. Benny and Scotty stare at the tabletop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It holds a scale model Baseball Diamond: green felt field and little bases, outfield wall and miniature player figures. A picture on the wall of Mr. Mertle and Babe Ruth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew Babe Ruth?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE Yeah. And he knew me too. (BEAT) They never let us play together, but we were friends. Good friends. He was almost as great a hitter as I was. But, he'd of told you he was better. The picture is signed: "To Thelonius Johnson Mertle, the second greatest slugger I ever saw... Babe Ruth." A baseball game on the RADIO. As each play is CALLED, Mr. Mertle's hands deftly put his tiny players in the correct positions. Mr. Mertle is blind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE (CONT'D) (HOLDING BALL) This the one that went over my fence?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. Mr. Mertle brushes his fingers over the leather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE This is an old ball, boys. Really old. (BEAT) Hercules gave it a good chewing, didn't he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE You sound upset, son - what's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you see... that ball belongs to my stepdad... and, uh - it was signed by Babe Ruth. Mr. Mertle shakes his head... hands the ball to Scotty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE Hmm. Well, I'm sure your dad will understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so. On the RADIO, Wills steals second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE (TO BENNY) Son, move Maury Wills to second base for me, will ya? Benny moves the little figure to second base.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE (CONT'D) If he steals third that'll be number
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . (TO SCOTTY) Helluva pickle you're in, boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir... Mr. Mertle retrieves something from a glass case. A baseball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE I'll make you a deal. If you boys come over once a week and talk baseball with me, I'll trade you balls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, that's really nice of you... but this ball really is signed by The Babe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE (CHUCKLES) This one really is too... and all the rest of the '27 Yankees. He hands his baseball to Scotty... Benny stares at it in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh my God - Murderers' Row. As they ogle the ball:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lou Gehrig...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Babe Ruth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE (SMILING) They're all there. Scotty hands Mr. Mertle the chewed up Babe Ruth ball. Shakes his hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deal. On the RADIO, Maury Wills steals 3rd for his 100th stolen base. Scotty notices the wall clock:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom's car is in the driveway. Scotty goes up the walkway slowly. Benny just behind him. The gang lingers at the sidewalk. Scotty sets one foot on the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and Bill comes out. He looks none-too-pleased. He towers over Scotty. The gang hangs their heads.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This better be good. Benny unpockets a little felt bag. Hands it to Scotty. He holds the bag up to a perplexed Bill, who opens it. He looks from Scotty to Benny and back again. Then... ...stares down at the "Murderers' Row" ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: sailing through the air. SMACK! it's caught in a brand new glove. Scotty's new glove. Scotty snap throws the ball back to Bill. He and Scotty are having a great game of catch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was weird that Benny said Babe Ruth was like the Hercules of baseball, and then The Beast's name turned out to be Hercules. (BEAT) It was also strange that Mr. Mertle had a Murderers' Row ball to replace the one signed by The Babe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bill and Scotty smile as they fire the cowhide back and forth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some people might say that it was all a coincidence... but looking back at it now, it seems like everything was connected, just like me and Benny. (BEAT) It was like we were a part of the same myth as The Babe... the Myth of Baseball. Scotty's mom sticks her head out the back door. She smiles, watching her "two boys" toss the ball around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guys, supper's ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Give us another ten minutes. I'm helpin' my boy break in his new glove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE'S BASEBALL ROOM - DAY Mr. Mertle sits contentedly behind his little "diamond." The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: calls Maury Wills' 104th steal of 1962.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MERTLE'S DIAMOND HIS HAND moves a wooden figure from 1st to 2nd. This tactile "playing field" becomes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...this one, where the guys are playing ball. There's a new addition to their team. A mascot. A big mascot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in a t-shirt and cap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: all play as if, somehow, this may be the last time they ever get to be a team. As they play, they're "sponged" from the
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in this order: Yeah-Yeah, Repeat and Timmy, Ham, DeNunez, Bertram, Squints, Hercules, Scotty, Benny.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was the last summer that we all got to play together. (MORE)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it would stay with us forever. (as they all dissolve:) Yeah-Yeah's parents shipped him off to military school. Timmy and Tommy grew up to build skyscrapers. Ham went to college and became a pediatrician. DeNunez played triple A ball and never got to the majors. Bertram got really into the sixities and no one ever saw him again. Squints grew up and married Wendy Peffercorn; they bought the Five & Dime and they still own it to this day. Hercules lived to be 199 years old... in human years. Everyone but Benny has vanished from the Sandlot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After Benny pickled the Beast, his reputation spread all over town. From then on he was known as Benny "The Juet" Rodriguez.
direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The nickname stuck with him the rest of his life.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (FAMILIAR) That's a triple, and that'll put the winning run on third, with two out in the bottom of the ninth. What a shot!

direction.raw_text: From the dugout, TOMMY LASORDA calls for a pinch runner. A PLAYER comes out of the dugout, stripping off his warm-up jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Lasorda's sending in a pinch runner - and it'll be... (DRAMATIC PAUSE) I don't believe it! Lasorda's calling up the "Old Man" to pinch-run in the biggest clutch situation this season! They say the veteran's lost a step or two. But if I were you, I'd get ready for some fireworks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is on its feet as 40-year-old BENNY "THE JET" RODRIGUEZ takes over third base from the PLAYER already there. They shake hands on the exchange. The 3rd base COACH walks over to The Jet. Pats him on the back.

direction.raw_text: Give 'em hell, Jet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll do my best, Maury. The Coach moves into the coaching box... turning his back to us. Emblazoned across his jersey, is the name W I L L S.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes the signal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leads off 3rd base - ten steps! The Pitcher fires to 3rd. The Jet hand tags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: settles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leads off. Eleven steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fires to 3rd again. The Jet gets back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: leads off again. Twelve steps. The pitch - strike. The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: tosses it back. Just then...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...The Jet moves. So fast that no one knows he's gone till it's too damn late. The Pitcher awkwardly throws home. The Catcher wipes the baseline. Too late... ...the dust clears. The UMPIRE eagle-wings the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! SAFE! SAFE! The tag missed by two feet. It's all over. The Crowd jumps to its feet. The Dodger dugout is all over The Jet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) The Dodgers win the pennant! The Dodgers win the pennant! The Jet breaks through his adoring teammates just long enough to give "Thumbs Up" to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) (CONT'D) I don't believe it, the Old Man stole home! The Old Man -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...39-year-old SCOTT SMALLS - The Announcer - who returns "Thumbs Up."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (after a pause) The Jet stole home! The Jet stole home!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Jet signs autographs for swarming KIDS. As the CROWD'S CHEERING CONTINUES and ECHOES into the past, we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the 9 best (11-year-old) buddies that ever lived. On a makeshit baseball diamond - a sandlot... circa 1962. They're all holding something forward - displaying - one palm up, hand beneath another - together like the nine musketeers: A baseball. A baseball with a familiar smudge.
